content.raw:
# Reference #

* Setup: Run callgrind on pr2.world for ~1 hour on default branch.
* `dworldQuickStep`
    * Inclusive cost = 60.47 (a higher number means it is heavy user of CPU)
    * Called = 10,131 (number of times this function was called)

# Valgrind part 1 #

* Setup: Run callgrind on pr2.world for ~1 hour on default branch.
* Result: Look at `ODELink::MoveCallback`
    * Inclusive cost = 0.41
    * Called = 486,288
* Result: Look at the push operation in `ODELink::MoveCallback`
    * Inclusive cost = 0.13
    * Count = 486,288

# Valgrind part 2 #

* Setup: Run callgrind on pr2.world for ~1 hour on default branch.
* Result: Look at `ODELink::MoveCallback`
    * Inclusive cost = 0.44
    * Called = 681,072
* Result: Look at the push operation in `ODELink::MoveCallback`
    * Inclusive cost = 0.14
    * Count = 681,072

# Conclusion #

There is a performance hit, but it is negligible. I only ran this test twice, so some of the performance hit could be noise. I'm okay with the `_AddDirty` function call.
content.html:
Reference

  • Setup: Run callgrind on pr2.world for ~1 hour on default branch.
  • dworldQuickStep
    • Inclusive cost = 60.47 (a higher number means it is heavy user of CPU)
    • Called = 10,131 (number of times this function was called)

Valgrind part 1

  • Setup: Run callgrind on pr2.world for ~1 hour on default branch.
  • Result: Look at ODELink::MoveCallback
    • Inclusive cost = 0.41
    • Called = 486,288
  • Result: Look at the push operation in ODELink::MoveCallback
    • Inclusive cost = 0.13
    • Count = 486,288

Valgrind part 2

  • Setup: Run callgrind on pr2.world for ~1 hour on default branch.
  • Result: Look at ODELink::MoveCallback
    • Inclusive cost = 0.44
    • Called = 681,072
  • Result: Look at the push operation in ODELink::MoveCallback
    • Inclusive cost = 0.14
    • Count = 681,072

Conclusion

There is a performance hit, but it is negligible. I only ran this test twice, so some of the performance hit could be noise. I'm okay with the _AddDirty function call.

content.raw: check for null `entity` pointer?
content.html: check for null entity pointer?

content.raw: I added an ASSERT, but I don't want to add an `if` check. This function is called many times, and needs to be as fast as possible. It's also strictly internal, and we have checked for a valid pointer for more than 6 years. e1f1097
content.html: I added an ASSERT, but I don't want to add an if check. This function is called many times, and needs to be as fast as possible. It's also strictly internal, and we have checked for a valid pointer for more than 6 years. e1f1097

content.raw: in some places `_WIN32` is used instead of `_MSC_VER`. Which one should be used?
content.html: in some places _WIN32 is used instead of _MSC_VER. Which one should be used?

content.raw: As far as I can tell, they are interchangeable.
content.html: As far as I can tell, they are interchangeable.

content.raw:
_MSC_VER is only set by the [Microsoft C++ compiler](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b0084kay.aspx), it contains the major/minor version number of cl.exe.  It doesn't appear to be set by mingw on windows.  _WIN32 is set by mingw.

```
D:\>cat test.cc
#include <iostream>

int main()
{
#ifdef _MSC_VER
    std::cout <<"_MSC_VER: " << _MSC_VER << std::endl;
#else
    std::cout << "No _MSC_VER" << std::endl;
#endif

#ifdef _WIN32
    std::cout <<"_WIN32: " << _WIN32 << std::endl;
#else
    std::cout << "No _WIN32" << std::endl;
#endif
}

D:\>g++ --version
g++ (i686-posix-dwarf-rev2, Built by MinGW-W64 project) 4.9.1
Copyright (C) 2014 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

D:\>g++ test.cc && test.exe
No _MSC_VER
_WIN32: 1
```
content.html:
_MSC_VER is only set by the Microsoft C++ compiler, it contains the major/minor version number of cl.exe. It doesn't appear to be set by mingw on windows. _WIN32 is set by mingw.

D:\>cat test.cc
#include <iostream>

int main()
{
#ifdef _MSC_VER
    std::cout <<"_MSC_VER: " << _MSC_VER << std::endl;
#else
    std::cout << "No _MSC_VER" << std::endl;
#endif

#ifdef _WIN32
    std::cout <<"_WIN32: " << _WIN32 << std::endl;
#else
    std::cout << "No _WIN32" << std::endl;
#endif
}

D:\>g++ --version
g++ (i686-posix-dwarf-rev2, Built by MinGW-W64 project) 4.9.1
Copyright (C) 2014 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

D:\>g++ test.cc && test.exe
No _MSC_VER
_WIN32: 1

content.raw: I guess we can just wait for pull requests from mingw users...
content.html: I guess we can just wait for pull requests from mingw users...

content.raw: Yup, updates can always be made.
content.html: Yup, updates can always be made.
